segments.text: I notice the woman’s foot is already in the water, but she’s just focused on that plate.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are being so sneaky, and she has no idea.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is going to hurt himself climbing like that, and she’s not even looking.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is just gushing out, and it’s only a matter of time before it’s everywhere.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how careless she’s being, just ignoring everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is so patient, just waiting for her cookie like it’s the most normal thing.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The stool is about to tip, and I’m just standing here watching it happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole kitchen is going to be ruined if someone doesn’t do something soon.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like yelling at her to turn around and see what’s happening.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between the calm garden and this mess inside is just too much.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I don’t know how she can be so oblivious to all of this.
segments.speaker: PAR
